newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks close higher on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks close higher on short-covering.

text.p: Pakistani stocks closed higher on Sunday on short-covering in blue chips ahead of Monday's settlement day, dealers said.
The Karachi 100-share index ended 12.84 points, or 0.95 percent, higher at 1,369.13 amid 128 losers and 89 gainers.
The market remained firm throughout the day with interest in speculative stocks such as Pak-Suzuki Motor, which closed 3.50 rupees up at 43.50, dealer Asif Jan said.
Another dealer said speculation that the government might announce an IMF-inspired reform package prompted individuals to square their positions.
Speculative stocks including PTCL Hub Power and ICI Pakistan traded within a narrow margin due to the uncertain economic situation, analyst Salman Rasheed said.
PTCL rose 0.15 to 31.30, Hub Power 0.35 to 31.30, Dewan Salman 0.85 to 26.25, Fauji Fertilizer 1.00 to 71.10, ICI Pakistan 0.25 to 15.95 and Adamjee Insurance 1.00 to 84.00.
